lines: You arrived in front of the Novák's villa.
Wow... so this is the house my mom grew up in!
Oh wait - before I go in... what was the Czech word for aunt again? I need to remember before I go in cause I want to try to greet my aunt in Czech! ____ Růžena (fill in the blank)
Yes! How could I have forgotten that!
No... Let me think... let me think...
I give up. I think I wrote it down somewhere in my journal. Let's see...
Teta Růžena, of course!
You walk up to the door and knock.
knock knock
The door opens and you see a young woman standing in the doorway.
I don't think this could be my aunt... She looks way too young.
"<cz>Vy musíte být pan Tobiáš</cz>."
Uh oh... what should I say back? "Vy musíte být pan Tobiáš."
-> "Dobrý den. Ano. Nemluvím česky."
Hotel?! That's not why I came... I don't think it's the right time to be joking right now.
I should at least try to say something...
"<cz>Já jsem Jana. Služebná u rodiny Novákových. Pojďte se mnou. Paní Růžena už na Vás čeká</cz>."
What is it that she just said about my aunt? Paní Růžena už na Vás "čeká". She ______.
Oh, right! She is waiting for me! ("čeká")
Hmm... why would she be cleaning when she has a maid? It's probably somehting else.
You sniff the air to try and smell something cooking.
Jana looks at you as she probably immediately figured out what you might have been thinking -
Jana shakes her head and smiles.
"<cz>Ne ne. Ona nevaří, ale čeká na Vás v jídelně</cz>."
Jana leads you inside the villa and you follow her.
You step closer to the broom. As you barely touch it, it drops on the ground and makes a loud noice when touching the stone pathway.
Jana, working in the garden behind you, looks up with an "aha, I just remembered something" kind of expression and quickly comes over.
You utter a quick apology - "<u><link="omlouvám se">Omlouvám se</link></u>!"
"<cz>To nevadí. Zrovna jsem si ale vzpomněla na něco, co jsem slyšela po té večeři před třemi dny</cz>."
"<cz>Když jsem umývala nádobí, slyšela jsem nade mnou zvuky, jako kdyby někdo posouval nábytek — postel, židli — prostě něco se šoupalo po zemi</cz>."
"<cz>Nevím, jestli je to důležité, ale radši jsem to chtěla zmínit. Slyšela jsem to přímo nad sebou a přímo nade mnou je pracovna</cz>."
You lean in to smell the flowers, taking in their fresh scent.
Jana strolls over, smiling.
"<cz>Tohle je levandule. Má krásnou fialovou barvu, že? Pěstujeme ji hlavně kvůli vůni, ale velké plus je, že taky odpuzuje komáry</cz>!"
What do you think "levandule" means? levandule (fill in the blank)
Yes! Kinda obvious, isn't it?
No... let's not ovethink this. I think I know this one.
Le... leva... levandule... Oh!
Levandule means levender of course!
roof at villaoutside placeholder.
fence at villaoutside placeholder.
tree at villaoutside placeholder.
